cyclone.name: BARRY
cyclone.current_location: about 100 miles SW of the mouth of the Mississippi River and 115 miles SSE of Morgan City, Louisiana
cyclone.trajectory: forecast to turn northwest then north, tracking toward the central Louisiana coast and then up the Mississippi Valley
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: central Louisiana coast (near Morgan City/Intracoastal City)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Hurricane Watch from the Mouth of the Mississippi River to Grand Isle LA and Intracoastal City to Cameron LA; Tropical Storm Watch east of the Mouth of the Pearl River to the MS/AL border
weather_observation.warning_coast: Hurricane Warning Intracoastal City to Grand Isle LA; Tropical Storm Warning Mouth of the Pearl River to Grand Isle LA, Lake Pontchartrain/Maurepas, and Intracoastal City to Cameron LA; Storm-Surge Warning Intracoastal City to Biloxi MS incl. Lake Pontchartrain
weather_observation.impacted_coast: North-central Gulf Coast from the upper Texas coast eastward to the western Florida Panhandle, with the highest impacts expected along the central Louisiana and Mississippi coasts
weather_observation.wind: Low (≤6%) chance of sustained tropical-storm-force winds; occasional gusts in outer rainbands possible Saturday
weather_observation.storm_surge: Minor coastal inundation below 2 ft possible along the upper Texas coast due to onshore flow
weather_observation.rainfall: Outer bands could drop 1–2 inches of rain with isolated higher totals, but widespread heavy rainfall is not expected at the port
weather_observation.other_hazards: Elevated rip-current risk and occasional squalls reducing visibility for vessel traffic
